actions.committee: Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare (Subsequently: Human Resources)
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare (Subsequently: Human Resources).

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that the identity of the manufacturer of a prescription drug appear on the label of the package from which the drug is to be dispensed.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that 180 days after enactment of this Act labels of prescription drugs manufactured in final dosage form show the name and place of business of the manufacturer and, if different, the name and place of business of the packer or distributor.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require that the identity of the manufacturer of a prescription drug appear on the label of the package from which the drug is to be dispensed.
